content.raw:
Could you elaborate on what your setup is where you’re seeing these errors? On Ubuntu 18.04, I’ve tried building with both GCC and Clang in Debug, Release, and RelWithDebInfo modes, and none of those combinations are producing any kind of exception, seg fault, or any teardown issue on any of the tests.

Also, nothing about memory, storage, or data of any kind is being affected by these changes. The only thing that’s changing is the inheritance structure, but all objects in that inheritance structure are empty.
content.html:
Could you elaborate on what your setup is where you’re seeing these errors? On Ubuntu 18.04, I’ve tried building with both GCC and Clang in Debug, Release, and RelWithDebInfo modes, and none of those combinations are producing any kind of exception, seg fault, or any teardown issue on any of the tests.

Also, nothing about memory, storage, or data of any kind is being affected by these changes. The only thing that’s changing is the inheritance structure, but all objects in that inheritance structure are empty.

content.raw: ok, I probably had something funky in my setup, like a deb of ign-plugin installed to /usr while testing in a colcon workspace. it looks like the pipeline is passing without these problems. sorry for the distraction
content.html: ok, I probably had something funky in my setup, like a deb of ign-plugin installed to /usr while testing in a colcon workspace. it looks like the pipeline is passing without these problems. sorry for the distraction

content.raw:
I just applied the changes to the include folder to `ign-physics1` and built against the ign-plugin branch, and it didn't have any compilation problems. I also ran it through the abi checker with `-quick` (otherwise it runs out of memory), and it didn't have any complaints either.

I think it would be safe to rebase this and target it to `ign-physics1`
content.html:
I just applied the changes to the include folder to ign-physics1 and built against the ign-plugin branch, and it didn't have any compilation problems. I also ran it through the abi checker with -quick (otherwise it runs out of memory), and it didn't have any complaints either.

I think it would be safe to rebase this and target it to ign-physics1

content.raw: In fact, I would make a pull request with just the changes to the header files, which wouldn't have any speed-up but should confirm that it's backwards compatible. Then we can target a separate pull request with the other changes that actually speed things up
content.html: In fact, I would make a pull request with just the changes to the header files, which wouldn't have any speed-up but should confirm that it's backwards compatible. Then we can target a separate pull request with the other changes that actually speed things up

content.raw: I think something about this PR also makes it more amenable to ccache, `make -j16` only takes about 11s to execute on repeat invocations. :100:
content.html: I think something about this PR also makes it more amenable to ccache, make -j16 only takes about 11s to execute on repeat invocations.
